qas.question: Which footballer was verbally attacked in Liverpool?
What team did Rooney transfer to?
What was Rooney's age at the time of the Hillsborough disaster?
Who was managing editor of The Sun in 2005?
How did Dudman describe The Sun's Hillsborough coverage?

context: On 7 July 2004, in response to verbal attacks in Liverpool on <a0_0>Wayne Rooney<a0_0/>, just before his transfer from Everton to <a1_0>Manchester United<a1_0/>, who had sold his life story to The Sun, the paper devoted a full-page editorial to an apology for the "awful error" of its Hillsborough coverage and argued that Rooney (who was still only <a2_0>three years old<a2_0/> at the time of Hillsborough) should not be punished for its "past sins". In January 2005, The Sun's managing editor <a3_0>Graham Dudman<a3_0/> admitting the Hillsborough coverage was <a4_0>"the worst mistake in our history"<a4_0/>, added: "What we did was a terrible mistake. It was a terrible, insensitive, horrible article, with a dreadful headline; but what we'd also say is: we have apologised for it, and the entire senior team here now is completely different from the team that put the paper out in 1989."
